hero.title: Web SDK Documentation
hero.subtitle: This document provides a comprehensive guide to using the Yarrow Map Web SDK for embedding and interacting with Yarrow maps in your web application.

installation.title: Installation
installation.description: First, add the {sdk} to your project using your preferred package manager.

initialization.title: Initialization
initialization.description: To get started, you need to create an instance of {yarrowMap}. This requires a configuration object that specifies the container element, center coordinates, and zoom level.
initialization.coordinateFormat: This SDK uses [longitude, latitude] format for map configuration (matching MapLibre GL convention), but [latitude, longitude] format for all other methods like routing and markers (matching common usage).

configuration.title: Configuration Options
configuration.description: The {yarrowMapConfig} class accepts a single configuration object:

reactUsage.title: React Usage
reactUsage.intro: React APIs are exported from the
reactUsage.hookDescription: You can also use the hook for custom composition with
reactUsage.configKeyDescription: Control map recreation explicitly when configuration identity changes with
reactUsage.ssrNoteDescription: The React integration initializes the map only on the client side.
reactUsage.controlsNoteDescription: By default, all MapLibre controls (zoom, navigation, attribution) are removed during initialization. Use MapLibre

comments.containerComment: ID of the div element to render the map in
comments.containerParam: string | HTMLElement - ID of the div element or the element itself
comments.centerParam: [number, number] - Initial center [longitude, latitude] - MapLibre convention

basicMap.title: Basic Map Manipulation
basicMap.description: Learn how to control your map's appearance and view programmatically.

changeMapStyle.title: Changing the Map Style
changeMapStyle.description: You can change the map's visual style. The available styles are {satellite}, {hybrid}, and the default map style.

changeTheme.title: Changing the Map Theme
changeTheme.description: You can set the initial theme in the configuration or switch between light and dark themes dynamically after initialization.
changeTheme.autoRefetch: Automatically re-fetches appropriate styles from the server
changeTheme.updateLayers: Updates all map layers to match the theme

moveMapView.title: Moving the Map View
moveMapView.description: You can programmatically move the map to a new location or fit it to a specific geographic area.
moveMapView.fitToFeatures: Fitting the map to a set of features:
moveMapView.fitDescription: This is useful when you want to display a set of points, lines, or polygons and ensure they are all visible.

backgroundColor.title: Changing Background Color
backgroundColor.description: You can change the background color of the map programmatically:

note.title: Note:
note.description: The changeBackgroundColor method waits for the map style to be fully loaded before applying the background color change.

codeComments.switchHybrid: Switch to hybrid view (satellite with labels)
codeComments.switchDefault: Switch back to the default map style
codeComments.flyToLocation: Fly to a new location with a specific zoom level
codeComments.changeBackground: Change the map background to a custom color

handlingEvents.title: Handling Events
handlingEvents.description: You can listen for various user interactions with the map.

mapMovement.title: Listen for Map Movement
mapMovement.description: Execute a callback function whenever the map finishes moving.

mapClicks.title: Listen for Map Clicks
mapClicks.description: Execute a callback when the user clicks on the map.

poiClicks.title: Listen for Clicks on POIs or Buildings
poiClicks.description: You can add click listeners to specific groups of features on the map, like {pois} or {buildings}.

codeComments.onLayerAlias: Note: onLayerClick is an alias for onIconClick (same method)

layersAndData.title: Working with Layers and Data
layersAndData.description: Learn how to add custom data, markers, and layers to your map.

addGeoJSON.title: Adding a GeoJSON Layer
addGeoJSON.description: You can add custom data to the map in the form of a {geoJsonLayer}. This is useful for displaying points, lines, or polygons.

advancedConfig.title: Advanced Layer Configuration
advancedConfig.description: The {addLayer} method supports advanced configuration options for different layer types:

markers.title: Adding and Removing Markers
markers.description: You can add markers to the map to indicate specific locations.
markers.element: Custom HTML element for the marker
markers.draggable: Whether the marker can be dragged (default: false)
markers.anchor: Anchor point of the marker relative to its coordinates

removeLayer.title: Removing a Layer
removeLayer.description: You can remove a layer that you've previously added.

codeComments.uniqueLayerName: A unique name for the layer
codeComments.addRedMarker: Add a simple red marker (default color)
codeComments.addMarkerOptions: Add a marker with all options
codeComments.addCustomHTML: Add a marker with custom HTML element

routing.title: Routing
routing.description: The SDK provides powerful routing capabilities for different transportation modes.
routing.coordinateFormat: The SDK uses [latitude, longitude] format for all user-facing coordinate parameters (routing, markers, etc.), which is then internally converted to MapLibre's [longitude, latitude] format where needed.

simpleRoute.title: Building and Displaying a Simple Route
simpleRoute.description: Calculate and display a route between a start and end point.

multiStopRoute.title: Building and Displaying a Multi-Stop Route
multiStopRoute.description: You can also create a route that passes through {multipleWaypoints}.

clearRoutes.title: Clearing Routes
clearRoutes.description: To remove all route-related layers from the map:

multipleRoutes.title: Rendering Multiple Routes
multipleRoutes.description: You can render multiple route features with automatic color coding:

features.title: Features:
features.autoColors: Automatically assigns different colors to each route (#3b82f6, #10b981, #f59e0b, #ef4444, #8b5cf6)
features.separateLayers: Creates separate layers for each route (${baseLayerName}-0, ${baseLayerName}-1, etc.)
features.defaultName: Default base layer name is 'route' if not specified

codeComments.routeFeatures: Array of route features (GeoJSON LineString features)
codeComments.renderCustom: Render routes with custom base layer name

search.title: Search
search.description: Search for locations and display the results on your map.

highlighting.title: Highlighting Search Results
highlighting.description: You can perform a search and display the results on the map. The search is performed around the {currentMapCenter}.

advancedConfig.title: Advanced Search Configuration
advancedConfig.description: The {highlightSearchResults} method accepts comprehensive configuration options:

configOptions.title: Configuration Options:
configOptions.layerName: Custom name for the search results layer
configOptions.iconImage: Custom icon image to use for search results
configOptions.zoomToResults: Automatically zoom to fit search results
configOptions.onIconClick: Callback when a search result icon is clicked
configOptions.onResultsUpdate: Callback when search results are updated

features.title: Features:
features.autoResearch: Automatic re-searching when the map is moved (debounced)
features.autoCleanup: Automatic cleanup of previous search results

codeComments.removeResults: To remove the search results from the map later
codeComments.autoZoomToResults: Automatically zoom to fit the results

publicTransport.title: Public Transport
publicTransport.description: Display real-time public transportation information on your map.

realTimeBuses.title: Displaying Real-Time Bus Locations
realTimeBuses.description: You can display the {realTimeLocations} of buses on the map.
realTimeBuses.specificRoute: Show buses for a specific route:
realTimeBuses.allBuses: Show all buses in the current map view:
realTimeBuses.allBusesDescription: If you don't provide a {routeId}, the map will show all buses within the visible area.

clearingBuses.title: Clearing Bus Routes
clearingBuses.description: The {showBusRoute} method returns a cleanup function that you can call to stop displaying bus locations and remove all related data:

cleanupInfo.title: What the cleanup function does:
cleanupInfo.stopUpdates: Stops the automatic bus location updates (15-second interval)
cleanupInfo.removeMarkers: Removes all bus markers from the map
cleanupInfo.removeLayers: Removes all route layers from the map

performanceInfo.title: Performance Optimization:
performanceInfo.maxBuses: Maximum 100 buses displayed at once (randomly selected if more exist)
performanceInfo.radiusFiltering: 5km radius filtering for general bus display (no route_id)
performanceInfo.viewportFiltering: Automatic viewport filtering for subsequent updates
performanceInfo.iconCaching: SVG icon caching for better performance

automaticUpdates.title: Automatic Updates:
automaticUpdates.mapMovement: Map movement triggers bus location refresh (for general display)

codeComments.stopShowing: To stop showing the bus route later
codeComments.stopShowingAll: To stop showing all bus routes
codeComments.laterClear: Later, clear the bus route display

utilityMethods.title: Utility Methods
utilityMethods.description: Helper methods for working with geographic data.

boundingBox.title: Calculating Bounding Box
boundingBox.description: The SDK provides a utility method to calculate the bounding box of GeoJSON data:

clearLocalCache.title: Clearing Local Cache
clearLocalCache.description: You can clear cached map resources programmatically:

advancedFeatures.title: Advanced Features
advancedFeatures.description: Advanced customization, performance optimization, and best practices.

customIcons.title: Custom Icons and Styling
customIcons.loadingDescription: The SDK automatically loads and caches icons from the server during initialization. You can reference these icons by name in your layers:
customIcons.customDataDescription: You can also provide custom icon data directly:

layerManagement.title: Layer Management:
layerManagement.autoCleanup: Layers are automatically cleaned up when re-added with the same name
layerManagement.sourceRemoval: Sources are removed along with layers to prevent memory leaks
layerManagement.iconCache: Icon images are cached to avoid redundant loading

busOptimization.title: Bus Route Optimization:
busOptimization.maxBusLimit: Maximum bus limit prevents performance issues with large datasets
busOptimization.viewportFiltering: Viewport-based filtering reduces unnecessary marker creation
busOptimization.debouncedUpdates: Debounced updates prevent excessive API calls

memoryManagement.title: Memory Management:
memoryManagement.autoCleanup: Automatic cleanup of intervals and event listeners
memoryManagement.markerRemoval: Proper marker removal prevents memory leaks

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.reuseLayerTitle: 2. Reuse layer names for dynamic content:

codeComments.iconsAutomatic: Icons are automatically available after init()
codeComments.referencesIcon: References the icon from feature properties
codeComments.autoCleanupPrevious: This will automatically clean up the previous layer
codeComments.avoidGeneric: Avoid: generic names that might conflict

methods.init: Initialize the map with styles and icons
methods.changeTheme: Switch between light and dark themes
methods.fitBounds: Fit map to show all features
methods.addLayer: Add a layer to the map
methods.removeLayer: Remove a layer from the map
methods.addMarker: Add a marker to the map
methods.removeMarker: Remove a marker from the map
methods.buildRouteWithLabels: Build and display a route with labels
methods.clearAllRoutes: Clear all route layers and popups
methods.highlightSearchResults: Highlight search results with cleanup function
methods.showBusRoute: Show bus locations with cleanup function

support.title: Support
support.description: For issues, questions, or contributions, please visit the project repository or contact the Yarrow development team.
